paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the effects of doxepin on HERG channels, specifically focusing on variants in the KCNH2 gene, including N588K and S631A, but does not provide detailed penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Notably, this study also establishes doxepin as an effective inhibitor of mutant (N588K) HERG channels responsible for variant 1 of the short QT syndrome.

functional_data.summary: The N588K variant was shown to be inhibited by doxepin, indicating its functional relevance in the context of drug interactions.

variants.additional_notes: The paper primarily focuses on the pharmacological effects of doxepin on HERG channels and does not provide extensive clinical data on penetrance.
key_quotes: Notably, this study also establishes doxepin as an effective inhibitor of mutant (N588K) HERG channels responsible for variant 1 of the short QT syndrome.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The S631A point mutation has been reported to shift IHERG inactivation by ∼+100 mV.

functional_data.summary: The S631A variant was also shown to retain the ability to be inhibited by doxepin, indicating its functional relevance.

variants.additional_notes: The paper primarily focuses on the pharmacological effects of doxepin on HERG channels and does not provide extensive clinical data on penetrance.
key_quotes: The S631A point mutation has been reported to shift IHERG inactivation by ∼+100 mV.

extraction_metadata.notes: The paper provides limited clinical data on penetrance and does not include extensive patient demographics.
